question.question: What is the recommended treatment for external haemorrhoidal thrombosis?
question.option_a: Surgical excision of the thrombosed hemorrhoid
question.option_b: Topical application of a corticosteroid cream to reduce inflammation
question.option_c: Ligation of the hemorrhoidal arteries to prevent further thrombosis
question.option_d: Administration of a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) to manage pain
